name: Tanoa Aspen Hotel Queenstown

reviews.text: This hotel is a little out of the way but as there is a bus service into town very 30 minutes ($5 return) it didn't really bother us. The rooms were clean and spacious and had everything we needed. The outside area leading to the room could do with a little updating and the balcony wasn't great but the rooms itself was fine. Disappointed Wifi wasn't free but $10 for 24 hours wasn't too bad - much better than the some places in the North Island!
reviews.title: Average hotel but bargain price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a lovely night at the Tanoa Aspen Hotel. The front desk was very friendly and helpful advising us of the bus to town, walking is definatly possible but the hill is very steep so going down is fine but we didnt attempt coming back up and for $4 return the bus was great value. The room was adaquate however considering the amazing views advertised was a little dissapointed when we looked out over a car park however it was cheap so I guess that if you pay more you may get a room with a view. The only complant about the room was that it was insanley hot, their was a fan provided but I dont sleep great with a fan blowing on me, I guess thats a hard problem to solve though. The restaurant was nice we didn't have a meal but enjoyed nice drinks and some lovely hot chips on the deck taking in the view. We didn't have a meal becasue the restaurant was very busy with a tour bus, but this was fine as Queenstown offers great food anyway. We had a lovely time and for a good deal this is a great place.
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel from 28th oct to 30th oct 2011. This is my first trip to new zealand and after staying a dissapointed stay in a motel in christchurch on 27th oct this came as a beautiful change.My room came with an awesome view of wakatipu lake and snow clad mountains.The restaurant came with the same view and it was so relaxing.The room was clean and warm and came with a single bed and a queen size bed. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Though the hotel is a bit far from the town there is bus service right from the hotel lobby for 5 dollars for a return trip.The restaurant food was good and the internet charges were reasonable. I would definitely want to stay at this hotel during my next trip.
reviews.title: AWESOME

reviews.text: I stayed @ Tanoa Apen from the 10-14th September and Tanoa made my stay PERFECT in terms with everything.
reviews.title: PERFECT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service is excellect....
reviews.title: Pleasantly Surprised

reviews.text: We were supposed to be here two nights but due to weather stayed in Queenstown for four nights. I found this hotel very comfortable. The rooms were nice and large with a lot of closet space. The washroom was also very clean. I found the staff very friendly and humourous - so no issues staying here extra nights.
reviews.title: Very comfortable and good service

reviews.text: The only downside is it is a bit of a trek to the city. You can take a $5 return bus that stops right in front of the hotel. Or, if you want to stay in shape ... a nice 45 min walk up a slightly steep slope will give you some exercise.
reviews.title: Little out of town. But Beautiful, and quiet, location. Great Staff

reviews.text: First things first. Its about a 20 minute walk into town or a 35 minute walk out of town. (Its uphill climb on the way back.)
reviews.title: Rooms run down and in need of a paint...

reviews.text: Still there is a shuttle bus service, $4.00ish dollars return, that runs pretty regularly. Though not late in the evenings. Plus taxi's are about $10.00. So bear that in mind when booking.
reviews.title: Best Views in QTown but Average Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We walked in once, as a group, and its a really nice walk in. Particularly on the lake.
reviews.title: Don't be tricked by the name Aspen

reviews.text: Bit far from centre - 30mins walk or 8mins in a taxi.
reviews.title: bit far from centre of QT

reviews.text: Staff friendly and helpful when my room card stopped working - twice!!
reviews.title: Shots, shots and more shots!

reviews.text: rooms large and clean and modern with kettle/iron/fridge too
reviews.title: Very pleasant and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent views - not all rooms have balconies though. Mine didn't but all my friends did and we paid the same price!
reviews.title: Bit runned down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast ok, bar prices reasonable for a hotel.
reviews.title: million dollar views without the price tag

reviews.text: We stayed two nights here in August. Had purchased a good deal online so very reasonably priced. Room was adequate, liitle tired and dated. Bed was comfy. Restaurant was nice with different specials ie Sunday roast etc. Fantastic view from the restaurant. Was a bit out of town but a pleasant walk down the hill to get there. We were there when the huge storm hit so were snowed in which was amazing. Thought we would have to stay extra nights, which the hotel was able to offer. Did however manage to get out late afternoon, they didn't charge us extra and were helpful and friendly. Was a pleasant stay in Queenstown if not a very white and chilly stay!
reviews.title: Snowed In!

reviews.text: We slept in the Lake Facing View with a double bed with an extraordinary view of the mountains. They had supplies of hair dryer, hot chocolate powder and coffee and tea. A small fridge with milk. The room was heated and very warm, the bed was comfy (because I think it was duck down feathers)
reviews.title: Spectacular View!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Staff were friendly and helpful, the restaurant was very nice, with nice view, their food was very nice aswell, our favourite was "Margarita Pizza" and "Strawberry Cheesecake" (yum). The price was ok, they did not have much selection of food so we bought most of our food from town.
reviews.title: Great views, service, amenities

reviews.text: To get to town, their is a bus "Connectabus" $5 per person and that is return, pick up from Tanoa Aspen Hotel.
reviews.title: Best sleep ever...

reviews.text: If you are looking to go to "The Remarkables" or "Coronet Peak" ski area, you will have to catch the "Connectabus" to town, and walk to "The Station" and catch another bus (if you do not know where to find it, their will be an information service around, and I am sorry if I can't remember how much the price was, but I can only remember that it was a fine price)
reviews.title: Nice quiet hotel, abit far from town..

description: TANOA ASPEN HOTEL QUEENSTOWN,: Hotel with Altitude, with spectacular views overlooking Queenstown, Lake Wakatipu and the surrounding mountains we are the highest situated Hotel in Queenstown. Our Panorama Restuarant is open from 6.30am daily until 9.30am and then reopens from 6pm. Bar opens at 4pm with a large Screen showing all the main sporting fixtures.Weekend meal specials available every weekend.
